sense.name: format and transmission rules for computer communications
sense.commentary: PROTOCOL[+entity][+symbolic][+rule][+format][+communication][+computer] Technical specifications for how digital information is formatted
sense.examples: FTP is a file transfer protocol that enables users to copy files between their local computer and a remote network. HTTP is a protocol that transfers hypertext requests and information between computer servers and browsers. John is an expert on computer network protocols.

sense.name: codes of social conduct, rules of etiquette
sense.examples: Protocol prohibits the Crown Prince from making public statements in his defense. What is the correct protocol at conferences when one's neighbor dozes during a talk? It was certainly a breach of protocol for him to decline acceptance of a Nobel prize. Bob didn't seem to understand the protocols required of a host at a formal dinner party.

sense.name: official written record of diplomatic agreements, treaty
sense.examples: Both nations have agreed to abide by the new protocol. Negotiators are drawing up new protocols that will specify emission standards for the member countries.

sense.name: official written record of scientific or medical experiment
sense.examples: The protocol specifies the amount of increased dosage of the medication per successive administration of it. The drug manufacturer did not follow the published protocols for this new drug. A review by peer scientists is challenging the protocol described in this experiment.
